channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023100141
item.description:
Report X-2023100141

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-31T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found during the loading phase of a truck and was promptly placed into a lined hazmat tote and management was notified. DescribePack: The caps of the inner containers were loose causing the inner containers to leak and damage the package. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a lined hazmat tote with orientation stickers up to prevent and more of the liquid to be released.

item.title: Report E-2023100795
item.description:
Report E-2023100795

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that 1-275 gal poly tote of UN3264, CF P430 F24 was located with a possible faulty or loose lid. It was stated that the tote is not actively leaking but there is some product that collected at the lid, an estimated 0.5 gallons in a 1'x1' area, there were a few small impacted areas on the trailer floor around the edge of the tote the team cleaned and neutralized, only about a half gallon of product sloshed out of the tote. The tote cap was tightened down and the team performed a slosh test, no additional product released. The contractor created 1-5 gallon DF containing PPE and impacted rags as waste which was staged and left for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023091103
item.description:
Report X-2023091103

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to the damaged cage for further inspection because of the exterior packaging soiled yet dry. DescribePack: Upon inspection I saw the container dented, empty. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat bag and tote separated from other packages.
